required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enoblituzumab Plus MGA012 in Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2/3 Open-Label Trial to Evaluate Enoblituzumab in Combination With MGA012, With and Without Chemotherapy, in the First-Line Treatment of Patients With Recurrent or Metastatic Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 2/3, randomized, open-label study designed to evaluate safety and efficacy of enoblituzumab in combination with MGA012, with and without chemotherapy, in first-line treatment of patients with recurrent or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck (SCCHN). The study will be conducted in 2 modules, Module A (Phase 2) and Module B (Phase 3).

detailed_description.textblock: In Module A, approximately 200 patients will be randomized to 1 of 4 arms (approximately 50 patients each arm): pembrolizumab + chemotherapy, enoblituzumab + MGA012, enoblituzumab + MGA012 + chemotherapy, and MGA012 + chemotherapy. Data from the enoblituzumab + MGA012 arm and enoblituzumab + MGA012 + chemotherapy arm will be assessed to determine whether further evaluation of one of these arms in Module B is warranted. If one or more of the experimental arms demonstrates improved efficacy with acceptable safety compared to the pembrolizumab + chemotherapy arm, enrollment will be initiated in Module B with approximately 260 patients per arm (enoblituzumab + MGA012 with or without chemotherapy vs. pembrolizumab + chemotherapy).

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with best overall response of complete response (CR) plus partial response (PR) per RECIST 1.1

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse Events as assessed by CTCAE v 4.03 - Module A and B
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of adverse events and serious adverse events

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival - Module A and B
primary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to death from any cause

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients developing anti-drug antibodies to enoblituzumab and/or MGA012

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free Survival - Module A and B
secondary_outcome.description: Time from start of study treatment to the first documented disease progression per RECIST v1.1 or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Control Rate - Module A and B
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who experienced response of CR, PR or stable disease for at least 3 months from start of study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response - Module A and B
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the date of initial response to the date of first documented progression or death from any cause, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life QLQ-C30 - Module B
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC overall Quality of Life questionnaire QLQ-C30 on a scale of 0-100. Lower scores correlate with worse quality of life and higher scores correlate with better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life H&N-35 - Module B
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC Quality of Life questionnaire H&N-35 for head and neck cancer patients on a scale of 0-100. Lower scores correlate with worse quality of life and higher scores correlate with better quality of life.

clinical_study.condition: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically proven, recurrent or metastatic SCCHN not curable by local therapy
- No prior systemic therapy for SCCHN in the recurrent or metastatic setting (with the exception of systemic therapy completed > 6 months prior of given as part of multimodal treatment for locally advanced disease)
- Primary tumor locations of oropharynx, oral cavity, hypopharynx, or larynx
- HPV test results available (positive and negative eligible)
- ECOG Performance status of 0 or 1
- Adequate end organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Progressive disease within 6 months of completion of curatively intended systemic treatment for locoregionally advanced SCCHN
- Radiation or other non-systemic therapy within 2 weeks of randomization
- Diagnosis of immunodeficiency, or use of immunosuppresive therapy within 14 days of first dose of study drug

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
